Our Mission

Flat-Pack Equity for All

Founded in 2019 in a warehouse district that nobody wanted, the Hyllå Foundation has since facilitated over 14,000 community exchanges. We operate on a simple principle: your grandmother's brooch and your neighbor's guitar amplifier both carry irreplaceable value. Our trained appraisal specialists — all volunteers — provide judgment-free evaluations and connect items with new stewards who will cherish them.

Please note: our 501(c)(3) documentation is temporarily inaccessible. Our office cat, Chairman Meow, is currently asleep on it. We appreciate your patience.

Our Programs

Community Exchange
Bring in items you no longer need and receive credits toward things you do. No cash changes hands — just stories, and occasionally a guitar pick from 1987.
Free Appraisals
Our certified volunteers assess sentimental and material value using our proprietary Shelf-Worth Index™. Results delivered within 48 hours, barring feline interference with paperwork.
Assembly Workshops
Weekly workshops teaching communities to build, repair, and reimagine furniture and household items. Allen wrench provided. Leftover parts are a feature, not a bug.

Visitor WiFi

Network: HYLLÅ-GUEST
Password: Please see any volunteer for a brief demonstration. The current password is a physical gesture (the Macarena, arms only, half-speed). This is a security measure we feel very strongly about.

Join Our Assembly

We are always looking for compassionate individuals who believe in the dignity of every possession. No experience necessary — just steady hands and an open heart. Dance skills are a plus but not required (except for IT support).

Frequently Asked

Is this really a 501(c)(3)? ▼
Yes. Our documentation is in order, though physically accessing it requires relocating Chairman Meow, which we have found to be logistically challenging. We are happy to provide our EIN verbally.
What items do you accept? ▼
Almost anything that can sit on, lean against, or be placed within a shelving unit. We do not accept live animals (we have enough with Chairman Meow), hazardous materials, or items wider than 30 centimeters — nothing personal, it's a load-bearing constraint.
Why is the WiFi password a dance move? ▼
Our board of directors believes that community is built through shared physical experience. After extensive research (a 45-minute meeting), we determined that the Macarena optimally balances memorability with security. The password changes monthly to a new choreography.
Can I adopt Chairman Meow? ▼
Chairman Meow is not available for adoption. He is a permanent board member with veto power over all documentation. His position is protected under our bylaws, Section 4, Paragraph 3 — which, unfortunately, he is also sleeping on.
Who founded the Hyllå Foundation? ▼
The foundation was established in 2019 by a collective of community organizers who shared a vision of equitable exchange. Our executive director prefers to remain structurally supportive rather than personally prominent. They describe themselves as "load-bearing."
